chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
f1: R -> T
P: seq R
Ord: R -> R -> Prop

Goal:
sorted Ord P <-> SF_sorted Ord (SF_seq_f1 f1 P)

Premises:
SF_seq_f1 = fun (T : Type) (f1 : R -> T) (P : seq R) => {| SF_h := head 0 P; SF_t := pairmap (fun x y : R => (y, f1 x)) (head 0 P) (behead P) |} : forall T : Type, (R -> T) -> seq R -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
Notation seq := list
SF_sorted = fun (T : Type) (Ord : R -> R -> Prop) (s : SF_seq) => sorted Ord (SF_lx s) : forall T : Type, (R -> R -> Prop) -> SF_seq -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _]
sorted = fix sorted (T : Type) (Ord : T -> T -> Prop) (s : seq T) {struct s} : Prop := match s with | [::] => True | [:: h0] => True | h0 :: (h1 :: _) as t0 => Ord h0 h1 /\ sorted T Ord t0 end : forall T : Type, (T -> T -> Prop) -> seq T -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
SF_map_sort : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (s : SF_seq) (Ord0 : R -> R -> Prop), SF_sorted Ord0 s -> SF_sorted Ord0 (SF_map f s) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_size_f1 : forall (f2 : R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_size (SF_seq_f1 f2 P0) = Init.Nat.pred (size P0) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_lx_f1 : forall (f2 : R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_lx (SF_seq_f1 f2 P0) = P0 where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
sorted_nth : forall (Ord0 : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s : seq ?T), sorted Ord0 s < -> (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (size s))%nat -> forall x0 : ?T, Ord0 (nth x0 s i) (nth x0 s (S i))) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_ly_f1 : forall (f2 : R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_ly (SF_seq_f1 f2 P0) = belast [seq f2 i | i <- P0] where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
sorted_cat : forall (Ord0 : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s1 s2 : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), sorted Ord0 s1 -> sorted Ord0 s2 -> Ord0 (last x0 s1) (head x0 s2) -> sorted Ord0 (s1 ++ s2) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_cons_f1 : forall (f2 : R -> ?T) (h : R) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_seq_f1 f2 (h :: P0) = SF_cons (h, f2 h) (SF_seq_f1 f2 P0) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
foldr_rcons : forall (f : ?T0 -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T) (s : seq ?T0) (t : ?T0), foldr f x0 (rcons s t) = foldr f (f t x0) s where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
pairmap_rcons : forall (f : ?T -> ?T -> ?T0) (s : seq ?T) (h0 h x0 : ?T), pairmap f x0 (rcons (rcons s h0) h) = rcons (pairmap f x0 (rcons s h0)) (f h0 h) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
behead_rev : forall s : seq ?T, behead (rev s) = rev (belast s) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_ly_f2 : forall (f2 : R -> R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_ly (SF_seq_f2 f2 P0) = behead (pairmap f2 0 P0) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_make : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq ?T), size lx = S (size ly) -> SF_seq where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
head_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), head x0 (rev l) = last x0 l where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_size_cons : forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), SF_size (SF_cons h s) = S (SF_size s) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_lx_cons : forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), SF_lx (SF_cons h s) = fst h :: SF_lx s where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_cons_f2 : forall (f2 : R -> R -> ?T) (h : R) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_seq_f2 f2 (h :: P0) = SF_cons (h, f2 h (head 0 P0)) (SF_seq_f2 f2 P0) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_cons_dec : forall P0 : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P0 (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), P0 (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P0 s where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_cons_ind : forall P0 : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P0 (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), P0 s -> P0 (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P0 s where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
SF_fun_incr : forall (s : SF_seq) (y0 : ?T) (x : R) (Hs : sorted Rle (SF_lx s)) (Hx : head 0 (SF_lx s) <= x <= last 0 (SF_lx s)), SF_fun s y0 x = match sorted_dec (SF_lx s) 0 x Hs Hx with | inleft H => nth y0 (SF_ly s) (proj1_sig H) | inright _ => nth y0 (SF_ly s) (SF_size s - 1) end where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R Ord : R -> R -> Prop |- Type]
PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
FEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> FExpr C -> R
display_pow_linear : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
gen_phiZ : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> Z -> R

```coq
intros.
split.
- intro H.
  apply SF_map_sort.
  simpl.
  unfold SF_sorted.
  rewrite SF_lx_f1.
  assumption.
- intro H.
  unfold SF_sorted in H.
  rewrite SF_lx_f1 in H.
  assumption.
Qed.

original: intros. split. - intro H. apply SF_map_sort. simpl. unfold SF_sorted. rewrite SF_lx_f1. auto. - intro H. unfold SF_sorted in H. rewrite SF_lx_f1 in H. auto.
